subject: Writing
title: Rhetoric in Ancient India and China
description: A quick, practical guide to Rhetoric in Ancient India and China.

hook.text: The Greeks weren't alone. India and China developed their own traditions of persuasive argument independently.

buildup.text: In ancient India, the Nyaya school developed formal logic and debate rules as early as the 6th century BC.

discovery.text: Chinese philosophers like Mozi and Xunzi created persuasion theories focused on social harmony over individual victory.

climax.text: Different cultures built persuasion systems reflecting their values â€” not all rhetoric is about winning.

punchline.text: Persuasion looks different when the goal isn't victory but harmony.

quiz.question: What unique feature did ancient Indian debate rules include?
